docs.title: Welcome to CCSP Docs for RDPMS
docs.text:
This site provides documentation for RDPMS (Remote Diagnostics and Predictive Maintenance Solutions) for Indian Railways Signalling Systems, covering deployment and usage for various railway-related use cases.

For more details, visit Centre of Innovation for IoT/M2M.

docs.title: Welcome to RDPMS Guide
docs.text: This section provides useful details about the RDPMS project and its messages.

docs.title: About RDPMS
docs.text:
RDPMS stands for "Remote Diagnostics and Predictive Maintenance Solutions."
RDPMS is an application platform designed to monitor, analyze, and optimize the performance of assets in remote locations. 
The platform focuses on providing real-time diagnostics, maintenance alerts, and predictive analytics.
It enhance the reliability and efficiency of equipment, helping to prevent costly downtime and extend asset life.

For more details, please visit the RDPMS Standard Data Format Document.

docs.title: Architecture with CCSP
docs.text: This section provides an overview of the integration and high-level architecture of RDPMS with CCSP (Common Control & Service Platform).

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The architecture of RDPMS is designed to seamlessly integrate with CCSP for efficient monitoring, diagnostics, and predictive maintenance of assets. The platform ensures reliable data communication between various components, enabling real-time insights and control.

docs.title: Key Components of the Architecture
docs.text:
1. Station Gateway:
  2. Acts as the primary communication interface between local assets and the CCSP platform.

  3. Responsible for collecting diagnostic data, performing local processing, and forwarding necessary information to the cloud.

  4. Cloud AE (Application Entity):

  5. Hosts the central application logic for data aggregation, analytics, and decision-making.

  6. Facilitates real-time notifications and predictive analytics.

  7. CCSP Platform:

  8. Provides the middleware for managing data storage, subscriptions, and notifications.
  9. Ensures secure and standardized communication between Station Gateway and Cloud AE.

docs.title: High-Level Data Flow
docs.text:
1. Data Collection:
  2. The Station Gateway collects data from assets and sensors.

  3. Data is formatted into standardized payloads for transmission.

  4. Data Transmission:

  5. Standard MQTT topics are used to publish data from the Station Gateway to CCSP.

  6. CCSP stores the data and triggers notifications as needed.

  7. Cloud Integration:

  8. The Cloud AE subscribes to relevant CCSP topics.
  9. It processes the data for diagnostics, maintenance alerts, and predictive analytics.

docs.title: Benefits of Integration with CCSP
docs.text:
• Standardized Communication: Ensures uniform data exchange using oneM2M-compliant protocols.
  • Real-Time Insights: Enables real-time monitoring and diagnostics of assets.
  • Scalability: Supports the integration of multiple gateways and assets.
  • Predictive Maintenance: Leverages data analytics for proactive maintenance and reduced downtime.

docs.title: Station Gateway Overview
docs.text:
At each station, there shall be one embedded electronic unit called Station Gateway. It shall:

  • Receive raw data/parameter values from Sensors through IoT devices.
  • Collect data from diagnostic ports of various equipment for Signalling assets.
  • Transmit data to the RDPMS Application software hosted at the Railway cloud via the CCSP Layer (C-DOT Common Service Platform).
  • Use Standard oneM2M Data format and MQTT Protocol for communication.
  • Function as an Edge Computing Device at the station.

docs.title: Features of Station Gateway
docs.text:
• Inbuilt Protocol Converters: Ensuring connectivity with:
  • Datalogger
  • IPS (Integrated Power Supply)
  • Other equipment as referenced in clauses 3.3 & 4 of this document.
  • Diagnostic Features: Allows monitoring and troubleshooting.
  • Configuration Capabilities: Details are provided in Annexure A & B.

docs.title: About CCSP (C-DoT's Common Service Platform)
docs.text: C-DOT has developed a state-of-the-art, oneM2M-compliant C-DOT's Common Service Platform (CCSP), which facilitates standards-based IoT solutions deployment across the country.

docs.title: What is CCSP?
docs.text:
CCSP is an indigenously developed IoT platform based on the oneM2M standard, which has been declared the National Standard on IoT/M2M by TEC. It acts as a horizontal common service layer for IoT/M2M, offering a set of Common Service Functions (CSFs) required by various IoT verticals.

Supported IoT Verticals 
Energy  
Transport  
Agriculture  
Surveillance  
Smart buildings  
Smart street lights

docs.title: Supported Common Service Functions
docs.text:
C-DOT's Common Service Platform (CCSP) supports 11 Common Service Functions (CSFs), which provide a standardized foundation for IoT/M2M applications. These include:

  1. Registration
  2. Discovery
  3. Group Management
  4. Security
  5. Subscription and Notification
  6. Semantics
  7. Transaction Management
  8. Device Management
  9. Data Management and Repository
  10. Location Services
  11. Application and Service Layer Management

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text: In addition to the core CSFs, CCSP offers a range of advanced features designed to enhance IoT/M2M interoperability and efficiency:

docs.title: Interworking and Connectivity
docs.text:
• 3GPP Interworking for NIDD (Non-IP Data Delivery) for NB-IoT (Narrow Band IoT) Devices
  • Supports 3GPP T8 interface
  • Support for MN (Middle Node) and ASN (Access Service Node)
  • SSP (Service Subscription Provider) Restrictions

docs.title: Data and Device Management
docs.text:
• Flex Container for structured and flexible data storage
  • Field Device Configuration
  • Device Management over LWM2M (Lightweight M2M) Protocol and TR-069
  • Service Subscription Management

docs.title: Intelligent Data Handling
docs.text:
• Semantics-based Data Interpretation
  • Time Series Data Handling
  • Transaction Management
  • Resource Announcement Mechanism

docs.title: Benefits for IoT Application Providers
docs.text:
• Simplifies integration by hiding the complexity of: 
      - Secure communication
  - Device management
  - Data handling
    and ensures smooth interoperability across different IoT verticals through standardized APIs.

docs.title: Quick Summary
docs.text: The C-DOT's Common Service Platform is a robust, standards-based platform designed to empower IoT/M2M applications, which provides seamless and secure IoT/M2M deployments, ensuring scalability, interoperability, and reliability across diverse verticals.

docs.title: RDPMS Standard Data Formats
docs.text: Welcome to the RDPMS Standard Data Formats documentation. This page provides an overview of the various payload formats used within the RDPMS system for remote diagnostic and predictive maintenance solutions.

docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Payload Specifications
  • Examples
  • Best Practices
  • Resources

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The RDPMS (Remote Diagnostic Predictive Maintenance Solutions) system utilizes specific payload formats to ensure consistency, reliability, and efficiency in data processing and management. This documentation outlines these formats and provides guidelines for their usage.

docs.title: Diagnostic Payloads
docs.text: Details about the structure and content of diagnostic payloads.

docs.title: Predictive Maintenance Payloads
docs.text: Details about the structure and content of predictive maintenance payloads.

docs.title: Alert Payloads
docs.text: Details about the structure and content of alert payloads.

docs.title: Diagnostic Payload Example
docs.text:
{
    "deviceId": "12345",
    "timestamp": "2023-10-01T12:00:00Z",
    "diagnosticData": {
        "temperature": 75,
        "vibration": 0.02
    }
}

docs.title: Predictive Maintenance Payload Example
docs.text:
{
    "deviceId": "12345",
    "timestamp": "2023-10-01T12:00:00Z",
    "maintenancePrediction": {
        "component": "motor",
        "predictedFailureDate": "2023-12-01"
    }
}

docs.title: Alert Payload Example
docs.text:
{
    "deviceId": "12345",
    "timestamp": "2023-10-01T12:00:00Z",
    "alertType": "temperature",
    "alertLevel": "high"
}

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Ensure data consistency by adhering to the specified payload formats.
  • Validate payloads to prevent errors during processing.
  • Use appropriate data types for each field.
